clinical_study.brief_title: Conventional Caudal Block, Ultrasound Guided Caudal Block and Ultrasound Guided Erector Spinae Block for Pediatric Hip Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Conventional Caudal Block, Ultrasound Guided Caudal Block and Ultrasound Guided Erector Spinae Block for Pediatric Hip Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be conducted to compare the efficacy and safety of ultrasound guided erector spinae block , ultrasound guided caudal block and conventional caudal block for pain management after pediatric hip surgery.

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the pain scores by (FLACC) scale. (FLACC) scale will be assessed after surgery over 24 hours where (0 = Relaxed and comfortable, 1-3 = Mild discomfort, 4-6 = Moderate pain ,7-10 = Severe discomfort /pain)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in mean arterial blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Mean arterial blood pressure will be recorded before block performance at T0, intraoperatively at 15 and 30 minutes, then every 30 min till the end of surgery and after surgery at T (0, 2, 4, 6, 12, 24 h).
Heart rate will be recorded before block performance at T0, intraoperatively at 15 and 30 minutes, then every 30 min till the end of surgery and after surgery at T (0, 2, 4, 6, 12, 24 h).

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of Analgesic required in the first day after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The total dose of intravenous (IV) acetaminophen 15 mg/kg if FLACC scores between 2 and 4 at the first 24 h after surgery, and total dose of tramadol 1 mg/kg (IV) in case of FLACC score > 4.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to first rescue analgesic demand after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: measured from the end of surgery till patient require analgesia.

a successful block is defined as absence of significant changes in heart rate following surgical induction. Heart rate increase is not>20% of the basal levels. If the increase is>20%, the block is accepted as unsuccessful.
Block performing time is defined as the period between the insertion of the needle and termination of local anesthetic administration
Hypotension, bradycardia, postoperative nausea, vomiting, urinary retention, prolonged motor block, pruritus and local anesthetic systemic toxicity (LAST).

arm_group.description: Patients of this group will receive the conventional method (blind technique without ultrasound) of caudal block
Patients of this group will receive caudal block using ultrasound.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Ultrasound guided erector spinae plane Block
arm_group.description: Patients of this group will receive ultrasound guided erector spinae plane Block at the level of the transverse process of the second lumbar vertebrae(L2) .

intervention.description: Patients of this group will receive (0.5ml/kg) (plain bupivacaine 0.25% injected in the caudal epidural space) by the conventional method (blind technique without ultrasound).
Using ultrasound, patients of this group will receive (0.5ml/kg) (plain bupivacaine 0.25% injected in the caudal epidural space).

intervention.intervention_name: Ultrasound guided erector spinae plane Block
intervention.description: Under ultrasound guidance, patients of this group will receive (0.5ml/kg) (plain bupivacaine 0.25% injected beneath the erector spinae muscle sheath) at the level of the transverse process of the second lumbar vertebrae(L2).
intervention.arm_group_label: Ultrasound guided erector spinae plane Block

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Both sex
- ASA physical activity I, II
- Age 4-12 years
- Admitted for elective hip surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Parents refusal
- Children with severe systemic disease
- ASA III or IV
- Children with previous neurological or spinal anomaly, coagulation disorders
- History of premature birth
- Infection at the block injection site
- History of allergy to local anesthetics
- Bilateral hip surgery.
